intro: Barleria delamerei, commonly known as Delamere's barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to red. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky outcrops. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
